description: CenterPoint Energy Houston Electric's Commercial Load Management Program is a demand response program where commercial customers curtail load when notified by the utility. The program operates year-round with two distinct periods (Summer: June 1 - November 30, Winter: December 1 - May 31). Participants receive up to $40.00 per kW of verified curtailed load, paid at the end of each program period. The program includes scheduled curtailment tests (1-3 hours each) and unscheduled curtailments (up to 4 hours each) with 30-minute advance notice. Notably, there are NO PENALTIES for opting out of events or for non-participation, making this a low-risk program. The program is designed to reduce peak demand in the CenterPoint Energy service territory in a cost-effective manner to meet demand savings goals established by the Texas Legislature and Public Utility Commission of Texas (PUCT).

ercot_wholesale_market_interaction.dual_participation_notes: Program documentation does not explicitly address whether participants can simultaneously participate in ERCOT wholesale markets. In ERCOT, battery energy storage systems typically register as Generation Resources (for discharge) and Load Resources (for charge) and participate directly in Day-Ahead Market (DAM) and Real-Time Market (RTM). CenterPoint's program is a distribution-level utility program focused on load curtailment. Based on ERCOT market structure: (1) Behind-the-meter batteries serving customer load could participate in this utility DR program while also providing wholesale market services, but would need to ensure curtailment obligations are met. (2) Front-of-meter batteries registered with ERCOT would not typically participate in utility-level load management programs. (3) The lack of penalties for non-participation provides flexibility. (4) Customer should consult with CenterPoint Energy and their Qualified Scheduling Entity (QSE) to clarify dual participation rules.
ercot_wholesale_market_interaction.wholesale_market_priority: ERCOT wholesale markets typically take priority for registered resources
ercot_wholesale_market_interaction.recommendation: Contact CNPEE@CenterPointEnergy.com to clarify battery storage eligibility and dual participation rules before enrollment.

technical_fit.justification: Battery energy storage systems can provide load curtailment through several mechanisms: (1) Discharging to serve building load during events, reducing net grid consumption; (2) Shifting charging outside event windows; (3) Pre-charging before events to maximize discharge capability. The 30-minute notice period is VERY SHORT for battery dispatch optimization but manageable with automated systems. Only 6 events per year (2 tests + 4 operational) with 1-4 hour duration is very battery-friendly - low cycle count, low degradation impact. No penalties for non-participation reduces risk significantly.

economic_fit.justification: Payment structure analysis: $40/kW per 6-month period = $80/kW-year total. This is relatively LOW compared to other utility DR programs. For comparison: Con Edison CSRP offers $72-216/kW-year (location-based) + $1/kWh performance. However, low event frequency (only 6 events/year) and zero penalties make this a low-effort, low-risk revenue stream. Economics are MARGINAL as standalone program for battery justification but could be attractive as INCREMENTAL revenue stacked with ERCOT wholesale market participation (energy arbitrage, ancillary services). Main economic challenge: 30-minute notice may limit ability to optimize other revenue streams during events.

regulatory_fit.justification: Battery eligibility is NOT EXPLICITLY STATED in program documentation. Resource types listed focus on traditional load curtailment (HVAC, building systems). However, batteries are not explicitly prohibited. Key regulatory considerations: (1) Must have IDR or Smart Meter to measure curtailment - batteries behind customer meter would show as reduced load. (2) Located in CenterPoint service territory in ERCOT. (3) Unclear if batteries registered with ERCOT as Generation Resources can also participate in utility program. (4) Need clarification on 'verified curtailed load' measurement methodology for batteries. (5) No mention of dual participation restrictions with wholesale markets. CRITICAL: Contact CenterPoint (CNPEE@CenterPointEnergy.com) to confirm battery eligibility before pursuing.

operational_fit.justification: Very favorable operational characteristics: (1) Only 6 events per year = minimal operational burden. (2) NO PENALTIES for opting out or non-performance = can prioritize higher-value opportunities. (3) 30-minute notice is challenging but not impossible with automated dispatch systems. (4) 1-4 hour duration aligns well with typical battery discharge capabilities (2-4 hour systems). (5) Year-round program provides two payment cycles. (6) 24/7 event window creates some uncertainty for scheduling but low event frequency mitigates this. Main operational concern: Short notice period may conflict with day-ahead wholesale market positions.

battery_suitability.overall_justification: Battery suitability rated 'Good with Caveats' (overall ~6.5/10) because: POSITIVE FACTORS: (1) Simple capacity payment structure, (2) Very low event frequency (6/year), (3) Zero penalties for non-participation, (4) Compatible event durations, (5) Year-round revenue opportunity. NEGATIVE FACTORS: (1) Relatively low payment rate ($80/kW-year), (2) Battery eligibility not explicitly confirmed, (3) Very short 30-minute notice period, (4) Unclear interaction with ERCOT wholesale market participation, (5) 24/7 event window creates dispatch uncertainty. RECOMMENDATION: This program is best viewed as INCREMENTAL revenue for batteries primarily participating in ERCOT wholesale markets (DAM/RTM energy arbitrage and ancillary services). The low payment rate does not justify standalone battery investment, but the low event frequency and zero penalties make it attractive as supplemental revenue IF dual participation is allowed. CRITICAL NEXT STEP: Confirm battery eligibility and dual participation rules with CenterPoint before enrollment.

research_summary.key_finding: CenterPoint Energy's Commercial Load Management Program is a low-frequency (6 events/year), low-risk (zero penalties), capacity-based ($40/kW per 6-month period) demand response program operating year-round with 30-minute advance notice. Payment rate totals $80/kW-year. Battery eligibility is NOT EXPLICITLY CONFIRMED in program documentation, though not explicitly prohibited either.

research_summary.recommendation_for_battery_optimization: Battery participation is POTENTIALLY VIABLE but requires clarification. RECOMMENDED ACTIONS: (1) Contact CNPEE@CenterPointEnergy.com to confirm battery storage eligibility and methodology for measuring 'verified curtailed load'. (2) Clarify whether batteries registered with ERCOT can simultaneously participate. (3) Understand if behind-the-meter vs front-of-meter configuration matters. ECONOMIC ASSESSMENT: At $80/kW-year, this program provides MARGINAL standalone revenue but could be ATTRACTIVE as incremental revenue stacked with ERCOT wholesale market participation (DAM/RTM arbitrage + ancillary services). The low event frequency (6/year) and zero penalties make this very operationally friendly. PRIORITY LEVEL: MEDIUM - Pursue only after clarifying eligibility and dual participation rules. Do not rely on this program as primary revenue stream for battery justification in ERCOT - wholesale markets are far more lucrative.
